intro: Gnidia schweinfurthii, commonly known as the African ironwood, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and small, white flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. Its hard, heavy wood is highly valued for construction and tool-making due to its durability. Gnidia schweinfurthii is also known for its ability to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments.
